TITLE: The pt is an 80 yo man with multiple medical problems including
   prostate ca with mets to the spine. He recently was admitted for a
   ventral hernia repair and was eventually discharged to HRC. On [**9-28**]
   the pt presented from rehab with fevers, hypotension, and an altered
   mental status all c/w sepsis due to MRSA bacteremia.
   His course in the MICU has been complicated by persistent fevers and
   hypoxemia as well as an impaired mental status.
   Line infection (Central or arterial)
   Assessment:
   ID called this evening to inform team that the pts LUE AC PICC line has
   recent positive blood cultures.   However the pt has remained
   hemodynamically stable and afebrile all shift.  Of note, pts WBCC has
   risen from 15 this AM to 18 this afternoon.
   Action:
   Pts  PICC to be d/c
ed by IV RN shortly.  LUE radial a-line d/c
   earlier today per ID recs.
   Response:
   Pt does not appear septic @ this time.
   Plan:
   D/C PICC shortly.  Obtain PIV (IV RN to look shortly).
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   Pt received/maintained on 50% hi flow O2 mask with sats in mid/high
   90
s.  Of note, pt desats to mid 80
s fairly quickly when on RA.
   Action:
   Pt OOB to chair and sat upright.  Pt freq coached to cough/deep breath
   to optimize resp fxn.
   Response:
   Pt doing okay on current support.
   Plan:
   Cont to follow resp fxn/VS closely, attempt to wean FiO2 down if tol.
   Alteration in Tissue Perfusion
   Assessment:
   Pt with unstageable pressure ulcer on coccyx, Skin care RN consult
   completed today.
   Action:
   Per Skin care RN, please do not utilize dsg
s to this site that are
   adhesive.  Aquacell/Softsorb/paper tape dsg affixed to site/pt
   positioned on his side and maintained on First Step Kinair mattress.
   Response:
   Will cont to assess.
   Plan:
   Skin care RN to re-consult on Monday [**10-8**]^rd to assess progress.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   The pt is [**Name (NI) 1669**] times one/two.  Pt d/c
ed both a foley and an NGT today,
   despite soft wrist restraints maintained thoughout shift.  Dtr
   indicates that the pt has d/c
ed multiple health care devices in the
   past.
   Action:
   No psychoactive meds provided to pt.  Pt freq re-oriented to
   person/place/time/care rationale all shift to assist with nl
   cognition.  Verbal and non-verbal support also provided.
   Response:
   Pt appears to be coping poorly.
   Plan:
   Dtr visited today and kept up to date with POC/pt status and encouraged
   to visit more freq to assist with nl cognition/emotional
   coping/support.
